definition: China Times (newspaper)/abbr. for 中國時報|中国时报 [Zhong1 guo2 Shi2 bao4]
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
to hit home on the evils of the day (idiom); fig. to hit a current political target/to hit the nub of the matter
to hit the target where it hurts (idiom); fig. to hit home/to hit the nail on the head (in an argument)

sentences.english: They briefly came into contact at a very low speed while submerged.
sentences.chinese: 它們主要是在潛入水中時低速接觸彼此。

sentences.english: When you are … living in disobedience …
By the time I was in high school, I really enjoyed solving interesting problems.
sentences.chinese: 當我上高中時，我已經喜歡上了解答有趣的問題。

sentences.english: I had a boyfriend in my high school.
sentences.chinese: 我曾在高中時有一個男朋友。

sentences.english: I received a letter from my best friend from sixth grade through high school.
sentences.chinese: 那是我從六年級到高中時代最要好的朋友寄來的。

sentences.english: High school was absolutely the time of my life!
sentences.chinese: 高中時代無疑是我一生中最快樂的時光。

sentences.english: It is so salty that you can't sink when you are in the water.
sentences.chinese: 那裏的水很鹹，當你在水中時，你不會沉下去。

sentences.english: In junior high, she joined a manga club in a local bookstore.
sentences.chinese: 初中時，她加入當地一家書店創辦的漫畫俱樂部。

sentences.english: I should have thanked her after every touchdown I ever scored in high school.
sentences.chinese: 高中時的每次達陣得分，我都應該好好感謝她。

sentences.english: To Grace: the most lovely girl I think. Miss you in the heaven.
sentences.chinese: 你是我在高中時遇到的最可愛的女生。

sentences.english: At high school, mike’s homespun humour was the cause of much laughter.
sentences.chinese: 高中時，邁克樸素的幽默引起了很多笑聲。

sentences.english: At high school, mike's homespun humour was the cause of much laughter.
sentences.chinese: 高中時，邁克樸質的詼諧引起了良多笑聲。

sentences.english: Not necessarily, especially if no children are involved.
sentences.chinese: 未必，特別是當沒有孩子捲入其中時。

sentences.english: Those trees in the forest catch frie when lightning strikes them.
sentences.chinese: 當森林中的樹木被閃電打中時，就起火燒了起來。

sentences.english: Soldiers profaned the church when they stabled their horses in it.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們把馬拴在教堂中時，褻瀆了教堂。

sentences.english: Slimes no longer chase the player in water when they are not in aggressive mode.
sentences.chinese: 泥不再追逐的球員在水中時，他們沒有在攻擊模式。

definition: immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
to mix together (disparate substances)/to mingle/a mix/to be tangled up with
lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
to throw out/to get rid of
to be deeply concerned/to be troubled (by)
